title: 22.2 Breadth-First Search
content:
Section 22.2

Breadth-First Search

Summary

Explore graph level by level from a source vertex.

Key Points

  • Use a queue: visit vertex, enqueue unvisited neighbors
  • Discovers shortest paths (fewest edges) from source
  • Colors: white (undiscovered), gray (discovered), black (finished)
  • Time: O(V + E) - each vertex and edge examined once
  • Produces BFS tree of shortest-path distances

Pseudocode

BFS(G, s):
    for each vertex u: color[u] = WHITE, d[u] = âˆž
    color[s] = GRAY, d[s] = 0
    Q = {s}
    while Q not empty:
        u = DEQUEUE(Q)
        for each v in Adj[u]:
            if color[v] == WHITE:
                color[v] = GRAY
                d[v] = d[u] + 1
                ENQUEUE(Q, v)
        color[u] = BLACK

Why It Matters

Foundation for shortest paths in unweighted graphs, level-order traversal.
